english: Sun Yat-sen (Sun Zhongshan); Zhongshan (place name); central mountain (literal)

etymology.description: 中 ‘middle; central’ + 山 ‘mountain’ = ‘central mountain’; extended to toponyms and Sun Yat-sen’s alias.
etymology.interpretation: Literally ‘central mountain’, it names places and institutions and also serves as Sun Yat-sen’s widely used alias. In geographic contexts it can mean the central peak within a range or area.

examples.chinese: 孙中山是近代中国的革命先行者(孫中山是近代中國的革命先行者)。
examples.pinyin: Sūn Zhōngshān shì jìndài Zhōngguó de gémìng xiānxíngzhě.
examples.english: Sun Yat-sen is a pioneer of modern China’s revolution.

examples.chinese: 我们明天去中山市参观孙中山纪念堂(我們明天去中山市參觀孫中山紀念堂)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen míngtiān qù Zhōngshān Shì cānguān Sūn Zhōngshān Jìniàntáng.
examples.english: We will go to Zhongshan City tomorrow to visit the Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hall.

examples.chinese: 这条山脉的中山海拔最高(這條山脈的中山海拔最高)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo shānmài de Zhōngshān hǎibá zuì gāo.
examples.english: The central mountain of this range has the highest elevation.
